dt: {bc}the dried fruiting body of a fungus ({it}Fomes officinalis{/it} synonym {it}Polyporus officinalis{/it}) formerly used in medicine
{bc}any of a family (Agaricaceae) of fungi with the sporophore usually resembling an umbrella and with numerous gills on the underside of the cap

et: Middle English {it}agaryke,{/it} kind of mushroom used medicinally, probably {it}Laricifomes officinalis,{/it} borrowed from Latin {it}agaricum,{/it} a tree fungus, borrowed from Greek {it}agarikón{/it} (Dioscorides), probably from {it}Agaría,{/it} district of Sarmatia + {it}-ikon,{/it} neuter of {it}-ikos{/it} {et_link|-ic:1|-ic:1}
shortdef: the dried fruiting body of a fungus (Fomes officinalis synonym Polyporus officinalis) formerly used in medicine
any of a family (Agaricaceae) of fungi with the sporophore usually resembling an umbrella and with numerous gills on the underside of the cap

dt: {bc}a medium to large poisonous amanita mushroom ({it}Amanita muscaria{/it}) with a usually bright red cap

shortdef: a medium to large poisonous amanita mushroom (Amanita muscaria) with a usually bright red cap
